verses.verse: (A Psalm; a Song at the Dedication of the House. [A Psalm] of David.) I will extol <S%H7311><s%> Thee, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> for Thou hast lifted <S%H1802><s%> me up, And hast not let my enemies <S%H340><s%> rejoice <S%H8055><s%> over me.
O Lord <S%H3068><s%> my God, <S%H430><s%> I cried <S%H7768><s%> to Thee for help, <S%H7768><s%> and Thou didst heal <S%H7495><s%> me.

O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> Thou hast brought <S%H5927><s%> up my soul <S%H5315><s%> from Sheol; <S%H7585><s%> Thou hast kept <S%H2421><s%> me alive, <S%H2421><s%> that I should not go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit. <S%H953><s%>

Sing <S%H2167><s%> praise <S%H2167><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> you His godly <S%H2623><s%> ones, <S%H2623><s%> And give <S%H3034><s%> thanks <S%H3034><s%> to His holy <S%H6944><s%> name. <S%H2143><s%>

For His anger <S%H639><s%> is but for a moment, <S%H7281><s%> His favor <S%H7522><s%> is for a lifetime; <S%H9132><s%> Weeping <S%H1065><s%> may last <S%H3885><s%> for the night, <S%H6153><s%> But a shout <S%H7440><s%> of joy <S%H7440><s%> [comes] in the morning. <S%H1242><s%>
Now as for me, I said <S%H559><s%> in my prosperity, <S%H7959><s%> "I will never <S%H1077><s%> <S%H5769><s%> be moved. <S%H4131><s%>"

O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> by Thy favor <S%H7522><s%> Thou hast made my mountain <S%H2022><s%> to stand <S%H5975><s%> strong; <S%H5797><s%> Thou didst hide <S%H5641><s%> Thy face, <S%H6440><s%> I was dismayed. <S%H926><s%>
To Thee, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> I called, <S%H7121><s%> And to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> I made <S%H2603><s%> supplication: <S%H2603><s%>

"What <S%H4100><s%> profit <S%H1215><s%> is there in my blood, <S%H1818><s%> if I go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit <S%H7845><s%>? Will the dust <S%H6083><s%> praise <S%H3034><s%> Thee? Will it declare <S%H5046><s%> Thy faithfulness <S%H571><s%>?
"Hear, <S%H8085><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> and be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to me; O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> be Thou my helper. <S%H5826><s%>"

Thou hast turned <S%H2015><s%> for me my mourning <S%H4553><s%> into dancing; <S%H4234><s%> Thou hast loosed <S%H6605><s%> my sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> and girded <S%H247><s%> me with gladness; <S%H8057><s%>

That [my] soul <S%H9202><s%> may sing <S%H2167><s%> praise <S%H2167><s%> to Thee, and not be silent. <S%H1826><s%> O Lord <S%H3068><s%> my God, <S%H430><s%> I will give <S%H3034><s%> thanks <S%H3034><s%> to Thee forever. <S%H5769><s%>
